content:
LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement Class

In this Article

Configures the security settings of a local service. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement : System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelConfigurationElement

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ConfigurationElement
  • System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelConfigurationElement
  • LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement

Inherited Members

Constructors summary

LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement()

Initializes a new instance of the LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement class.

Properties summary

DetectReplays

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether replay attacks against the channel are detected and dealt with automatically.
InactivityTimeout

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration of inactivity the channel waits before it times out.
IssuedCookieLifetime

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the lifetime issued to all new security cookies.
MaxCachedCookies

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of cookies that can be cached.
MaxClockSkew

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the maximum time difference between the system clocks of the two communicating parties.
MaxPendingSessions

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of pending security sessions that the service supports.
MaxStatefulNegotiations

Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of security negotiations that can be active concurrently.
NegotiationTimeout

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the maximum duration for the security negotiation phase between server and client.
Properties
ReconnectTransportOnFailure

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether connections using WS-Reliable messaging attempt to reconnect after transport failures.
ReplayCacheSize

Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of cached nonces used for replay detection.
ReplayWindow

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which individual message nonces are valid.
SessionKeyRenewalInterval

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration after which the initiator renews the key for the security session.
SessionKeyRolloverInterval

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the time interval a previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal. The default is "00:05:00".
TimestampValidityDuration

Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which a time stamp is valid.

Constructors

  • LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement()

    Initializes a new instance of the LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement class.

    public LocalServiceSecuritySettingsElement ();

Properties

  • DetectReplays

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether replay attacks against the channel are detected and dealt with automatically.

    public bool DetectReplays { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if replay attacks against the channel are detected and dealt with automatically; otherwise, false. The default is false.

  • InactivityTimeout

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration of inactivity the channel waits before it times out.

    public TimeSpan InactivityTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A positive TimeSpan that specifies the duration of inactivity the channel waits before it times out. The default is "01:00:00".

  • IssuedCookieLifetime

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the lifetime issued to all new security cookies.

    public TimeSpan IssuedCookieLifetime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the lifetime issued to all new security cookies. The default value is "10:00:00".

    Remarks

    Cookies that exceed their lifetime are recycled and must be negotiated again.

  • MaxCachedCookies

    Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of cookies that can be cached.

    public int MaxCachedCookies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of cookies that can be cached.

  • MaxClockSkew

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the maximum time difference between the system clocks of the two communicating parties.

    public TimeSpan MaxClockSkew { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the maximum time difference between the system clocks of the two communicating parties. The default value is "00:05:00".

    Remarks

    When this property is set to the default, the receiver accepts messages with send-time timestamps up to 5 minutes later or earlier than the time the message was received. Messages that do not pass the send-time test are rejected. This setting is used in conjunction with the ReplayWindow property.

  • MaxPendingSessions

    Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of pending security sessions that the service supports.

    public int MaxPendingSessions { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of pending security sessions that the service supports. The default value is 1000.

    Remarks

    When this limit is reached, all new clients receive SOAP faults.

  • MaxStatefulNegotiations

    Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of security negotiations that can be active concurrently.

    public int MaxStatefulNegotiations { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of security negotiations that can be active concurrently. The default value is 1024.

    Remarks

    Negotiation sessions in excess of the limit are queued. They can only be completed when a space below the limit becomes available.

  • NegotiationTimeout

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the maximum duration for the security negotiation phase between server and client.

    public TimeSpan NegotiationTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A positive TimeSpan value that specifies the maximum duration for the security negotiation phase between server and client. The default is "00:02:00"

    Remarks

    If the time limit expires, an exception is thrown.

  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

  • ReconnectTransportOnFailure

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether connections using WS-Reliable messaging attempt to reconnect after transport failures.

    public bool ReconnectTransportOnFailure { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if connections using WS-Reliable messaging attempt to reconnect after transport failures; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    If this property is true, infinite reconnect attempts are attempted. The cycle is only broken by the inactivity time-out, which causes the channel to throw an exception when it cannot be reconnected.

  • ReplayCacheSize

    Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of cached nonces used for replay detection.

    public int ReplayCacheSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of cached nonces used for replay detection. The default value is 500000.

    Remarks

    If this limit is exceeded, the oldest nonce is removed and a new nonce is created for the new message.

  • ReplayWindow

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which individual message nonces are valid.

    public TimeSpan ReplayWindow { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which individual message nonces are valid.

    Remarks

    After the time specified by this property, a message sent with the same nonce as the one sent before is not accepted. This property is used in conjunction with the MaxClockSkew property to prevent replay attacks. An attacker can replay a message after its replay window has expired. This message, however, fails the maxClockSkew test that rejects messages with send-time timestamps up to a specified time later or earlier than the time the message was received.

  • SessionKeyRenewalInterval

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration after which the initiator renews the key for the security session.

    public TimeSpan SessionKeyRenewalInterval { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the duration after which the initiator renews the key for the security session. The default is "10:00:00".

  • SessionKeyRolloverInterval

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the time interval a previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal. The default is "00:05:00".

    public TimeSpan SessionKeyRolloverInterval { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the duration a previous session key is valid on incoming messages during a key renewal. The default is "00:05:00".

    Remarks

    During key renewal, the client and server must always send messages using the most current available key. Both parties accept incoming messages secured with the previous session key until the rollover time specified by this property expires.

  • TimestampValidityDuration

    Gets or sets a TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which a time stamp is valid.

    public TimeSpan TimestampValidityDuration { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A positive TimeSpan that specifies the duration in which a time stamp is valid. The default is "00:15:00".
